intro: Payena vulcanica, commonly known as the volcanic payena, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and opposite leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
